snippet: The economic crisis in Europe is becoming an existential one for the monetary union, officials say, unless governments act to solidify the alliance.
abstract: Economic crisis in Europe is becoming an existential one for the monetary union, officials say, unless governments muster the will and resources to solidify the alliance; many investors and money managers now see Europe's challenge going beyond a bail out of sickly Spanish banks to the broader concern of keeping Spain and even Italy afloat and in the euro zone as money continues leaving these countries.

byline.contributor: Nicholas Kulish contributed reporting from Berlin.

lead_paragraph: The economic crisis in Europe is becoming an existential one for the monetary union, officials say, unless governments act to solidify the alliance.

headline.seo: Euro Zone at a Crossroads, With the Union on the Line
headline.main: Euro Zone Is Lurching to a Crossroad
